main event: On 17 May 1956, approximately 20 round objects were observed in the sky, estimated to be between 50 to 100 feet in size.
interesting points: The objects were sharply outlined and had a projection in the center., The sighting lasted for about 20 seconds., The estimated speed of the objects was between 1000 to 1500 M.P.H., The observer noted that the objects appeared to be under intelligent control., The incident was poor in data collection and further investigation was deemed necessary.
witness description: The witnesses were a friend of the letter writer and the letter writer himself.
